task.title: Example: Creating a simple PDF plug-in
task.shortdesc: This scenario walks through the process of creating a very simple plug-in (com.example.print-pdf) that creates a new transformation type: print-pdf.

context.p: The print-pdf transformation has the following characteristics:

ul.li: Renders figures with a title at the top and a description at the bottom
Use em dashes as the symbols for unordered lists

step.cmd: In the plugins directory, create a directory named com.example.print-pdf.
In the new com.example.print-pdf directory, create a plug-in configuration file (plugin.xml) that declares the new print-pdf transformation and its dependencies.
Add an Ant script (integrator.xml) to define the transformation type.
In the new plug-in directory, add a cfg/catalog.xml file that specifies the custom XSLT style sheets.
Create the cfg/fo/attrs/custom.xsl file, and add attribute and variable overrides to it.
step.stepxmp: For example, add the following variables to change the page size to A4. cfg/fo/attrs/custom.xsl file

step.cmd: Create the cfg/fo/xsl/custom.xsl file, and add XSLT overrides to it.
step.stepxmp: For example, the following code changes the rendering of figure elements. cfg/fo/xsl/custom.xsl file

step.cmd: Create an English-language variable-definition file (cfg/common/vars/en.xml) and make any necessary modifications to it.
step.stepxmp: For example, the following code removes the period after the number for an ordered-list item; it also specifies that the bullet for an unordered list item should be an em dash. cfg/common/vars/en.xml file

result.note: The files for this sample plug-in are included in the DITA-OT installation directory under docsrc/samples/plugins/com.example.print-pdf/ and on GitHub.
result.p: The plug-in directory has the following layout and files:
result.codeblock: com.example.print-pdf ├── cfg │ ├── catalog.xml │ ├── common │ │ └── vars │ │ └── en.xml │ └── fo │ ├── attrs │ │ └── custom.xsl │ └── xsl │ └── custom.xsl ├── integrator.xml └── plugin.xml

ol.li: Run --install to install the plug-in and make the print-pdf transformation available.
Build output with the new transformation type to verify that the plug-in works as intended. --input=my.ditamap --format=print-pdf
